item.title: Algebraic Python Enums
item.description:
University has compelled me to utilize Python despite my fondness for Rust, primarily due to the prevalence of machine learning and data science. One aspect of Rust that I dearly miss is the availability of enumerable data types that can encapsulate various data types.

Although Python has the answer to creating structs as dataclasses, including support for structural match expressions in recent versions, most tutorials will suggest Union types as the equivalent to Rust’s enums.
